channel.title: External HDD
channel.description:
Well, my laptop only has 120Gb so I need more and I was thinking of buying a external HDD. I want one that is 1Tb of size, and that has a good speed/price ratio. I'll mainly use it for storing backups, text files, images and other downloads, so no games (i'll install those on my HDD). I was thinking about this one: Western Digital Elements WDE1U10000, €98. But that's only because it's so cheap.
What do you guys think?

item.title: External HDD
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

[quote=“mrrules, post:32, topic:236807”][quote author=the bank link=topic=312596.msg2490985#msg2490985 date=1224113335]
LaCie makes the best external hard drives and portable drives I have ever seen. Very fast, very stable.

If you take mopar’s route, get a Western Digital drive. 3 year warranty ;).

@Unhandled

Backups? I have 1T aswell, 2x500GB Western Digital.
[/quote]
Lol he wants to get 1 hard drive that is 1T… 2 500 is diffrent…

Why do you need that much space any ways??? Saving your hole life on it or something?[/quote]2x500gb = 1T you fucking idiot.

Also, cumescape is correct, having less data on a harddrive will in fact make it run faster.

As for so much space, I have over 600GB of data on my HDDs as is, so unlike yourself where the only bug files you download is porn, I need the space I have.

Read full topic

item.title: External HDD
item.dc:creator: @cumescape cumescape
item.description:
@cumescape wrote:

So you can put files from the main hard drive onto the spare, making the main faster.

Read full topic

item.title: External HDD
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

[quote=“RXVL, post:29, topic:236807”][quote author=R.I.P RSC link=topic=312596.msg2499553#msg2499553 date=1224579213]
I’ll order it today. I just have to figure out from which shop, because I want to order both the hdd and the case from the same shop so the mailing costs won’t be that high.
[/quote]

Newegg or TigerDirect, Newegg taxes certain areas but has a better RMA policy.[/quote]

I live in the Netherlands, so I wont be able to buy from those shops. Anyways, I ordered the seagate hdd and a mx-100 case, together with transport costs it was €144.16. Good price?

Read full topic

item.title: External HDD
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:14, topic:236807”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=312596.msg2492040#msg2492040 date=1224189656]

Really the cheapest way to go is to buy an external hard drive enclosure, then buy a hard drive and put them together yourself. (4 screws and a plug, child’s play)

Seagate Barracuda 7200.11 ST31000340AS, 1TB, SATA2, 32MB cache, 7200 rpm, 3.5". €104. Is that a good one?

Actually that is a great one, a 32mb cache is awesome!
[/quote]

The case needs a PSU thingy right?

Edit: I was thinking about it, I have a USB 2.0 port and a FireWire 400, so obviously I’ll use the USB. But USB 2.0 has a maximum of 480Mbit data transfer, so wouldn’t that HDD be overkill?[/quote]

It wouldn’t be overkill, the even though SATA2 supports ‘3gb/s’, it will never really go anywhere near that fast. The huge cache will also help out a lot.

Read full topic

item.title: External HDD
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:25, topic:236807”][quote author=runescape3dude link=topic=312596.msg2495025#msg2495025 date=1224355145]
With me, that would be a few months at best… I purchased a 200gb HDD, and it was 75% full after about 2 weeks. I was like “fuck… I need to conserve my space” Ever since then, I have been monitoring everything I do, but I still manage to use about half a gb a day…
Yesterday: 1.4GB
Day before: 1.8GB
Not sure about the rest…

uTorrent Statistics (For this computer):
Total Uploaded: 98.4GB
Total Downloaded: 72.8GB
Total Ratio: 1.351
Total Running time: 680:49:36
Number of files added: 139
Program started: 112 Times
[/quote]

I usually download via newsservers, but I’ve already downloaded 190GB. And I only have a 120GB HDD so I have to delete constantly.[/quote]On my laptop, it was something around 300gb. On my server, something like 30gb.

Read full topic

With me, that would be a few months at best… I purchased a 200gb HDD, and it was 75% full after about 2 weeks. I was like “fuck… I need to conserve my space” Ever since then, I have been monitoring everything I do, but I still manage to use about half a gb a day…

item.title: External HDD
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

[quote=“FastBawlz, post:18, topic:236807”][quote author=runescape3dude link=topic=312596.msg2492791#msg2492791 date=1224214368]
All of my hdds have 32mb cache… 80gb/80gb/200gb
Not sure about the ones in my servers…
[/quote]

Please, show me where I can buy some of these hard drives you have![/quote]
Sorry. I made an error. The 80gbs are 2mb and the 200gb is 16mb.

Read full topic

item.title: External HDD
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

[quote=“the bank, post:16, topic:236807”][quote author=runescape3dude link=topic=312596.msg2493642#msg2493642 date=1224281747]

Really the cheapest way to go is to buy an external hard drive enclosure, then buy a hard drive and put them together yourself. (4 screws and a plug, child’s play)

Actually that is a great one, a 32mb cache is awesome!
Seagate Barracuda 7200.11 ST31000340AS, 1TB, SATA2, 32MB cache, 7200 rpm, 3.5". €104. Is that a good one?

The case needs a PSU thingy right?

Edit: I was thinking about it, I have a USB 2.0 port and a FireWire 400, so obviously I’ll use the USB. But USB 2.0 has a maximum of 480Mbit data transfer, so wouldn’t that HDD be overkill?

Why don’t you get an SCSI card for your computer? They go at 1.6gpbs and they are like $5… Then you go and find some old SCSI drives (most are 10/15k RPM). That is the best way…
[/quote]Cus SCSI is for old farts.[/quote]
No it isn’t. It is an old design, yet almost all brand new servers use it.

Read full topic

item.title: External HDD
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:14, topic:236807”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=312596.msg2492040#msg2492040 date=1224189656]

Really the cheapest way to go is to buy an external hard drive enclosure, then buy a hard drive and put them together yourself. (4 screws and a plug, child’s play)

Actually that is a great one, a 32mb cache is awesome!
Seagate Barracuda 7200.11 ST31000340AS, 1TB, SATA2, 32MB cache, 7200 rpm, 3.5". €104. Is that a good one?

[/quote]

The case needs a PSU thingy right?

Edit: I was thinking about it, I have a USB 2.0 port and a FireWire 400, so obviously I’ll use the USB. But USB 2.0 has a maximum of 480Mbit data transfer, so wouldn’t that HDD be overkill?[/quote]
Why don’t you get an SCSI card for your computer? They go at 1.6gpbs and they are like $5… Then you go and find some old SCSI drives (most are 10/15k RPM). That is the best way…

item.title: External HDD
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Actually that is a great one, a 32mb cache is awesome!
Seagate Barracuda 7200.11 ST31000340AS, 1TB, SATA2, 32MB cache, 7200 rpm, 3.5". €104. Is that a good one?
[/quote][/quote]

The case needs a PSU thingy right?

Edit: I was thinking about it, I have a USB 2.0 port and a FireWire 400, so obviously I’ll use the USB. But USB 2.0 has a maximum of 480Mbit data transfer, so wouldn’t that HDD be overkill?

item.title: External HDD
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:6, topic:236807”][quote author=Unhandled link=topic=312596.msg2490978#msg2490978 date=1224113236]
What the hell do you need 1tb for?
[/quote]

I have 1.75TB almost full with computer games and Wii isos.

If you take mopar’s route, get a Western Digital drive. 3 year warranty ;).

I prefer seagate, I have had 3 or 4 Western Digitals go bad, only 1 Maxtor (which I also like) and no seagates go bad ever.[/quote]
I have a few seagate small portable hard drives [circular, hold 5-6 gigs], they don’t work very well anymore though. I always have to fiddle with the connector to keep it from getting disconnected.
[ontopic] I don’t know how this compares to other brands, but I really got my money’s worth with WD and SimpleDrive.

Read full topic
